result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery R Pugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffery R Pugh is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffery R Pugh was found guilty of Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Jeffery R Pugh was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Total restitution due during term of supervision.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Cts 1 & 2:  Per Court order, $750 bail on file applied to court costs.  Balance of court costs due during term of supervision.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.
Absolute sobriety.
Random testing.
Any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
Submit to DNA sample at Ozaukee County Sheriff's Dept by 7/30/16.

Arraignment at 03-14-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Jeffery R Pugh in court with attorney Verona Swanigan.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Robert Mueller sworn and testifies. State requests bind over. Based on testimony given the court will find the State has met its burden of proof and binds matter over for trial. State files information. Attorney Swanigan requests date for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for Destruction of Exhibits
Preliminary hearing at 02-08-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Jeffery R Pugh in court with attorney Verona Swanigan.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Continuation from competency hearing on 1/5/16. Atty Swanigan objects to evidence regarding blood alcohol level. State, case is in preliminary stage and discovery is still open and citation was mailed to defendant with blood alcohol level. Court will withhold ruling on matter at this time until after testimony. 
9:18 am/Witness Dr. Mosnik sworn and testifies. Counsel requests court to view Curriculum Vitae previously filed with the court. Court provides copy to State. Court takes judicial notice of said document. Testimony continues.
10:23 am/Court breaks for scheduling purposes.
10:38 am/Court resumes with same appearances. Testimony of Dr. Mosnik continues.
11:29 am/Court breaks.
11:32 am/Court resumes with same appearances. Parties address who has burden and if burden has been met. Arguments. Court addresses previous objection of ability of the two doctors to testify under expert opinion; court finds both doctors are qualified to testify as experts. Court addresses objection regarding blood alcohol information; court finds matter is not an issue as it is a difference of opinion of the experts. Court finds that the testimony of both doctors are credible. Court finds Mr. Pugh is competent to proceed. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jeffery R Pugh in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.   Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time. Def does not qualify for public defender. Counsel waives further reading of complaint. State requests $1000 cash with conditions.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
